How to use DAO Member private discord channels

A web3 onboarding funnel is a series of steps or stages that help introduce people to the concept of web3 and decentralized finance. Such a funnel would provide people with the necessary knowledge and tools to navigate the world of web3 and decentralized finance safely and effectively while avoiding common pitfalls such as scams and misinformation.
One potential approach to creating a web3 onboarding funnel might involve the following steps:
Start by explaining the basics of web3 and decentralized finance, including key concepts such as blockchain technology, decentralization, and the use of smart contracts.
Next, provide guidance on how to securely store and manage cryptocurrencies, emphasizing the importance of keeping one's private keys safe and never sharing them with others.

Introduce people to the concept of decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), and explain how they can be used to govern and coordinate decentralized networks in a transparent and democratic manner.
Provide resources and information on how to identify and avoid common scams and other forms of fraud in the web3 and decentralized finance space.
Finally, direct people to resources and tools that can help them find and join regenerative DAOs that align with their values and goals.

Overall, the key to creating an effective web3 onboarding funnel is to provide clear, concise, and accessible information that helps people understand the basics of web3 and decentralized finance, while also equipping them with the knowledge and tools they need to navigate this complex and rapidly evolving space safely and confidently.

children.title: Role Definition

content.text: What are the different ways to contribute to your
? Let your members know how they fit in.
DAO Member is a person, organization, multi-signature entity, or any other entity that holds at least one full share of

DAO. As a member, they have full access to the workspace, including the ability to view and comment on every page, create bounties, proposals, and suggestions for editing existing content, as well as unrestricted access to create unlimited pages, sub-pages, texts, and any other form of content they desire.
Team has a simple yet crucial mandate, which is to uphold the DAO Constitution and act in a responsible and ethical manner in the execution of its duties within the
. Their specific roles, obligations, and responsibilities are clearly outlined in the DAO Constitution.

Individuals, Multi-Sigs, or entities that complete any form of onboarding process are granted the role of a Community Member. This may include earning POAPs, participating in Discord chats, engaging on Twitter, earning NFT badges, attending events and receiving event tokens, earning ERC-20 tokens, winning limited edition NFTs, or participating in raffles. Community Members have access to the bounties section, information hub, and the ability to create proposals for DAO Members to review and consider.

children.title: Explainer Video Script

content.text: One Liner > Kokonut Network is a Project to Promote, Fund, & Manage Coconut Farms

Why Coconuts? > It is the most cultivated and vital palm tree in the world, as it is currently the main source of vegetable fat, Coconut is one of the plants that provide the greatest diversity of products and by-products in the world, being a primary source of food, drinks, and refuge for animals
In 2020, the global Coconut market size was
and it is expected to reach

Why a DAO and not a Company with Investors? > Answer is simple [Governance, Transparency, Accounting & Growth] while we build a worldwide community that share our vision and support us shape the future of agriculture + web3
: KokonutDAO shareholders will vote to determine the schedule of rewards for distribution in the future as new product launches, Charity Events & Agriculture Start-Ups Incubator Projects.
: Shareholders would be able to propose business ideas, proposals, new products and discuss ideas on how to enhance DAO funds far beyond the 40% base rewards from KOKONUT V1 profits.

With high demand from the national and international markets, Annual domestic production does not meet the demand. Every year Dominican Republic alone imports about 25 million units of coconut, which return to international markets as exports of coconut derivatives by-products.

We Incorporate six hundred and twenty (620) Acres of land in optimal conditions, into the national production system; to be able to increase national annual production by 18,000,000 coconuts, and decrease the shortage in the market. While we benefit and reward the whole KokonutDAO community and we create more than 10,000 direct and indirect jobs?¬†
"Kokonut V1" is our first coconut plantation located in Los Saladillos, Dominican Republic [map widget]

Kokonut V1 consists of 60,000 coconut plants that would produce roughly 18 million coconuts per year for wholesaling to international markets and to Industrialize its direct products, such as Copra and Water as a fresh drink, as well as its other derivatives to add value to production.

They will be planted at a sowing frame of 7.5 x 7.5 meters away from each plant. That is equivalent to ninety-six (96) plants per acre of land, which equals 60,000 plants within the six hundred and twenty (620) Acres of land in hand. This variety is capable of producing about three hundred (300) fruits per plant, which makes about 18,000,000 units each year. The market price is around USD 0.44 per unit, which would be equal to USD 7,920,000.00 per year alongside more than 10,663 direct and indirect jobs.

are for the paymentof agricultural insurance.

Forecast Expenses are just approximated. We will work every month on achieving milestones, based on the master business plan for each quarter. We will vote every 4 months to approve the quarter's budget, then we will do 1 monthly vote to approve the subsequent month's plan. The vote will take place on the 21st of each month.

for a healthy project, 1 KokonutDAO Share per plant will be issued Only 60,000 "kokonut dao shares" will issued for Kokonut V1. Each one for an contribution of USD$20.00. This way we achieve the initial funding amount needed, to develop the project for 4 years until the farm is ready for the first round of harvesting. More shares will be issued for our next phase Kokonut V2 300,000 Plants 2026~.

For the purpouse of Transparency, we will use blockchain technology for each coconut plant ownership and open source accounting and enterprise system so we can offer real-time access for every member of the KokonutDAO.
: $1,200,000 [4 years budget, ~16 years harvesting until re-planting]

‚Äî Our V1 Plantation consists of 60,000 coconut plants that will produce roughly 18,000,000 coconuts per year, average local wholesale price is $0.44 this equals $7,920,000 per year [we're already working on securing international buyers so we can export our product and get even more revenue.

‚Äî Coconuts is one of the most useful fruits on the planet, you can make coconut milk, coconut oil, coconut body cream, coconut water, and so on, the list is almost endless, that is why this is one of the most profitable fruits in the agriculture sector.

‚Äî Besides just producing and selling the coconut, we're also planning to create a range of products like coconut milk, coconut water, coconut pulp, and beauty products for retail and wholesale to international conglomerates.
all of the project sales, expenses, payroll, accounting and reports will be managed by an open source ERP System, API & username;passwords credentials will be available for KokonutDAO members.
Profesional Team With 35+ Years In Experience
KOKONUT LOGO > Join us on your favorite social network for more info
We're happy to answer. Email us at hello@kokonut.network and we'll get back to you ASAP.

informational campaign about coconuts and CTA for Kokonut Network
Social Media Channels Mainly Twitter & Facebook
Are you a coconut lover? Join our coconut plantation project and become a stakeholder in
the freshest, most delicious coconuts. Our sustainable farming practices ensure a plentiful supply of the tropical treat you love.
s a stakeholder, you'll have a say in how the coconuts are grown and harvested. Don't miss out on this tasty opportunity. Sign up now!
How can a person that loves to drink coconut water benefit from being a stakeholder at a coconut plantation, taking into account that this person and the plantation do not live in the same country

As a stakeholder in a coconut plantation, you can benefit from the profits that the plantation generates from the sale of coconut water. This can provide you with a source of income and can potentially help you to diversify your investment portfolio. Additionally, by being a stakeholder in a coconut plantation, you can have a say in how the plantation is run and can help to ensure that it is operated in a sustainable manner. This can help to protect the environment and can also help to ensure the long-term viability of the plantation. However, it is crucial to keep in mind that as a stakeholder in a coconut plantation that is located in a different country, you may face certain challenges and limitations. For example, you may have difficulty obtaining accurate and timely information about the plantation's operations, and you may also have limited ability to directly influence the decisions that are made by the plantation's management. Additionally, there may be legal and logistical challenges associated with owning and managing assets in a different country.
What if all of the limitations and challenges are being taken care of by a Global Organization that is using web3 technology for transparency and a cloud accounting system for easy reporting?

If a global organization is using web3 technology and a cloud accounting system to manage a coconut plantation and to provide transparency and easy reporting to stakeholders, it can potentially mitigate some of the challenges and limitations that stakeholders may face. Web3 technology, which is also known as the decentralized web, is a set of technologies and protocols that enable individuals and organizations to share and exchange information and value in a decentralized manner. This can help to ensure that stakeholders have access to accurate and timely information about the plantation's operations, and can also help to facilitate communication and decision-making among stakeholders. Additionally, a cloud accounting system can provide stakeholders with easy access to financial reports and other information about the plantation's performance, which can help them to make informed decisions about their investments. Overall, these technologies can help to enhance transparency and accountability in the management of the coconut plantation, which can benefit stakeholders by providing them with greater confidence in the plantation's operations.
Can you use these results to craft a long-form ad copy that promotes these values and features

Yes, you can use the information provided above to craft a long-form ad copy that promotes the values and features of being a stakeholder in a coconut plantation that is managed by a global organization using web3 technology and a cloud accounting system. The ad copy could highlight the potential benefits of being a stakeholder, such as the ability to earn income from the sale of coconut water, the opportunity to influence the plantation's operations and ensure sustainability, and the ability to access accurate and timely information about the plantation's performance. The ad copy could also emphasize the ways in which web3 technology and a cloud accounting system can enhance transparency and accountability, and can provide stakeholders with easy access to financial reports and other information. This can help to build trust and confidence among stakeholders and can help to promote the plantation as a sound investment opportunity. Here is an example of how the ad copy could be structured:

Are you looking for a unique and rewarding investment opportunity? Consider becoming a stakeholder in a coconut plantation that is managed by a global organization using web3 technology and a cloud accounting system. As a stakeholder, you can benefit from the profits that the plantation generates from the sale of coconut water, and you can have a say in how the plantation is run to ensure sustainability. Plus, web3 technology and a cloud accounting system provide transparency and easy access to financial reports, so you can stay informed and make informed decisions about your investment. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity ‚Äì become a stakeholder in a coconut plantation today!
Create another ad script but this time pack it with urgency and call to take action toward a better future for the next generations

If you're concerned about the future and want to take action to make a positive impact, consider becoming a stakeholder in a coconut plantation that is managed by a global organization using web3 technology and a cloud accounting system. As a stakeholder, you can help to ensure that the plantation is operated in a sustainable manner, which can help to protect the environment and preserve natural resources for future generations. And, by investing in a plantation that uses web3 technology and a cloud accounting system, you can have confidence that your investment is being managed transparently and responsibly. Plus, you can benefit from the profits that the plantation generates from the sale of coconut water. Don't wait ‚Äì take action now to secure a better future for yourself and for generations to come. Become a stakeholder in a coconut plantation today!

children.title: Define Kokonut Shares Use Cases

content.text: Kokonut Shares are Asset Backed by Coconut Trees Planted on our land.
Kokonut shares double as governance tokens to vote on DAO proposals
Kokonut shares enable access to IRL Perks

Shares of a company are units of ownership interest in that company. They represent a claim on a portion of the company's assets and earnings. When you buy shares of a company, you become a shareholder, which entitles you to certain rights, such as the right to vote on company decisions and the right to receive a share of the company's profits in the form of dividends. Shares are typically bought and sold on a stock exchange, and the price of a share is determined by the supply and demand for the stock.

Shares of a company can be a valuable asset for investors. When a company does well, the value of its shares can increase, which can provide investors with a return on their investment. In addition, many companies pay dividends to their shareholders, which can provide a regular income stream. Furthermore, owning shares in a company can give investors a sense of ownership and involvement in the company's success.

Kokonut DAO is a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) that uses a shared system to allow people to own shares in coconut trees. These shares represent ownership in the trees and entitle the shareholder to a share of the coconuts produced by the trees. This system allows people to invest in coconut farming without having to physically own or manage the trees themselves. The value of the shares is determined by the supply and demand for them, and the income from the coconuts is distributed to the shareholders. This provides a new way for people to invest in and benefit from the production of coconuts.

Kokonut shares not only provide ownership in coconut trees and entitle the shareholder to a share of the coconuts produced, but they also have several other utilities. As governance tokens, Kokonut shares allow shareholders to vote on proposals related to the management of the coconut trees. This enables them to have a say in the decisions that affect their investment. In addition, the shares provide access to real-life perks, such as discounts on coconut products and exclusive experiences related to coconut farming. Furthermore, the shares can be used as credentials to log into the Kokonut DAO's accounting system, allowing shareholders to track the performance of their investments. Overall, Kokonut shares are a valuable asset that provides investors with multiple benefits and opportunities.

Don't miss out! Become a shareholder in Kokonut DAO and own a piece of the coconut farming industry. With your shares, you'll be entitled to a share of the coconuts produced and have the ability to vote on proposals that affect your investment. Plus, you'll have access to real-life perks and exclusive experiences. Hurry, buy your shares now, and join the ranks of Kokonut DAO stakeholders!

children.title: Kokonut Network Stack

content.text: Software Like Framework Stack for Kokonut Network

A software stack is a collection of software programs and tools that work together to create a complete platform for running an application. It typically includes an operating system, a database management system, a web server, and an application runtime environment, among other components. The term "stack" is used because these components are often layered on top of one another, with each layer providing the necessary infrastructure for the layer above it to function properly. This allows developers to create complex applications without having to worry about the underlying infrastructure.

The same principles used in software stacks can be applied to real-world assets as well. In a broad sense, a real-world asset can be thought of as a collection of physical resources that work together to create value for an organization or individual. For example, a manufacturing plant might be considered a real-world asset because it includes machinery, buildings, raw materials, and other resources that are used to produce goods. In the same way that a software stack consists of different components that are layered on top of one another, a real-world asset can be made up of different layers of infrastructure that support each other and enable the asset to function properly. These layers might include things like transportation networks, power grids, and communication systems, among other things. The idea is to create an integrated system of resources that can be used to create value in an efficient and effective way.

A coconut plantation could be considered a real-world asset that consists of various layers of infrastructure and resources. For example, a coconut plantation stack might include the following components:
Land: This would be the foundation of the plantation, providing the space for the coconut trees to grow and for the other infrastructure to be built.
Coconut trees: These would be the main component of the plantation, providing the coconuts that are harvested and processed.
Irrigation systems: These would provide the necessary water for the coconut trees to grow and thrive.
Pesticide and fertilizer application systems: These would help to maintain the health and productivity of the coconut trees.
Harvesting and processing equipment: This would include the machinery and tools needed to collect and process the coconuts into products like coconut oil, milk, and flour.
Storage and transportation infrastructure: This would include the facilities and systems needed to store the processed coconut products and transport them to market.

In this way, a coconut plantation could be thought of as a stack of interconnected resources and infrastructure that work together to create value. Each layer of the stack provides the necessary support for the layers above it, allowing the plantation to function effectively and efficiently.

The resources and infrastructure that make up a coconut plantation stack could potentially be expanded and connected to other external resources in various ways. For example, some possible additional components that could be added to the stack might include:
Labor: This would include the workers who perform the various tasks required to operate the plantation, such as planting, watering, fertilizing, and harvesting the coconuts.
Financial resources: This could include the capital needed to purchase land, equipment, and other resources, as well as the financial institutions and investors that provide the funding.
Marketing and distribution networks: These would be the channels through which processed coconut products are sold and delivered to customers.
Support services: This could include things like legal, accounting, and consulting services that help the plantation to operate smoothly and efficiently.

In terms of connecting to external resources, a coconut plantation stack could potentially be linked to other industries and resources in a number of ways. For example, the plantation could connect to transportation networks, such as roads, ports, and railways, to facilitate the movement of goods to and from the plantation. It could also connect to power grids and communication systems to provide the necessary utilities and services. Additionally, the plantation could potentially connect to other agricultural operations to share resources and expertise, or to form supply chains and partnerships with other businesses. The possibilities for connections and collaborations are vast and could help a coconut plantation to become more efficient, effective, and sustainable.
There are many ways that a coconut plantation can become more efficient, effective, and sustainable. Some possible strategies for achieving these goals might include:

Implementing best practices for coconut tree care and management, such as using appropriate irrigation, fertilization, and pest control methods, and pruning and maintaining the trees to maximize their health and productivity.
Investing in modern harvesting and processing equipment, such as mechanical harvesters and advanced coconut processing facilities, to improve efficiency and reduce waste.
Developing sustainable sources of financing, such as partnerships with investors and financial institutions that are committed to supporting sustainable agriculture.

Establishing relationships with customers and distributors who value sustainable and ethical production practices, and who are willing to pay a premium for high-quality, sustainably-produced coconut products.
Investing in research and development to identify new, innovative uses for coconut products and to develop new, sustainable processing methods.

Engaging in partnerships and collaborations with other organizations and businesses, such as other coconut plantations, research institutions, and government agencies, to share knowledge, resources, and expertise.

By implementing these and other strategies, a coconut plantation can become more efficient, effective, and sustainable, and can contribute to a more sustainable and resilient agricultural system overall.

Intercropping and syntropic farming are both types of agricultural practices that involve growing multiple types of crops in close proximity to each other. The main difference between the two is the specific way in which the crops are arranged and the goals of the farmer.

Intercropping involves planting two or more different crops in the same field, with each crop occupying a specific area. The crops are typically arranged in strips or blocks, and they are often chosen based on complementary growth habits or nutritional needs. For example, a farmer might plant corn and beans together, with the corn providing support for the beans to climb. The goal of intercropping is usually to increase productivity and make the most efficient use of space and resources.

Syntropic farming, on the other hand, is a more holistic approach to agriculture that is based on the principles of permaculture. It focuses on creating self-sustaining ecosystems in which different plants, animals, and microorganisms work together to support each other's growth and productivity. In a syntropic farming system, the crops are arranged in a more natural, mimicking the patterns and relationships found in a healthy forest ecosystem. The goal of syntropic farming is to create a diverse and resilient agricultural system that is sustainable and beneficial to the environment.

Overall, the main difference between intercropping and syntropic farming is the way in which the crops are arranged and the goals of the farmer. Intercropping is focused on maximizing productivity, while syntropic farming is focused on creating sustainable and resilient ecosystems.

Intercropping is a type of agricultural practice in which two or more different crops are planted in the same field, with each crop occupying a specific area. This is different from traditional monoculture farming, in which a single crop is grown over a large area. Intercropping can be an effective way to increase productivity and make the most efficient use of space and resources.
There are several key best practices to consider when it comes to intercropping. These include:

Choose complementary crops: When selecting crops to plant together, it's important to choose ones that have complementary growth habits or nutritional needs. For example, planting a tall crop like corn alongside a climbing crop like beans can be beneficial because the beans can use the corn stalks for support.

Use strip or block planting: In intercropping, it's common to arrange the crops in strips or blocks, rather than mixing them together. This can make it easier to manage the crops and ensure that they have enough space to grow.

Monitor and manage pests and diseases: Because intercropping involves growing multiple types of crops in close proximity to each other, it's important to monitor the plants for pests and diseases. If a problem is detected, it's important to take appropriate action to prevent it from spreading to other crops.

Use appropriate spacing and density: When planting the crops, it's important to consider the spacing and density of the plants. This will depend on the specific crops being grown and the amount of space available, but generally, the plants should be spaced far enough apart to allow for adequate growth.

Use mulching and other techniques to conserve moisture: In intercropping, it's important to conserve moisture in the soil to support the growth of the crops. This can be achieved through the use of mulch or other techniques, such as drip irrigation.

Overall, intercropping can be a valuable tool for increasing productivity and making the most efficient use of space and resources in agriculture. By following these best practices, farmers can maximize the benefits of intercropping and create a more sustainable and resilient agricultural system.

This can be beneficial because the beans can use the corn stalks for support, allowing both crops to grow more effectively. The corn can also provide shade for the beans, which can help to conserve moisture in the soil and protect the beans from excessive sunlight.

In terms of conserving moisture, mulching is one technique that can be effective in an intercropping system. Mulch is a layer of organic material, such as straw or leaves, that is placed on top of the soil. This can help to retain moisture in the soil, prevent weeds from growing, and regulate the temperature of the soil.
For example, if a farmer is growing corn and beans together in an intercropping system, they might use

mulch to conserve moisture in the soil. The mulch would be placed around the base of the corn and bean plants, helping to keep the soil moist and providing a protective layer for the plants. This can improve the growth and productivity of the crops, and it can also help to conserve water and reduce the need for irrigation.

Overall, choosing complementary crops and using mulching are both important best practices to consider in an intercropping system. These practices can help to maximize the productivity and sustainability of the system, and they can contribute to the overall success of the agricultural operation.

There are many different crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system, and the specific crops that work well together will depend on a variety of factors, such as the climate, soil conditions, and the goals of the farmer. Some examples of crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system include:

Corn and beans: Corn and beans are a classic example of crops that work well together in an intercropping system. The corn provides support for the beans to climb, and the beans can help to fix nitrogen in the soil, which can be beneficial for the corn.
Wheat and clover: Wheat and clover are other example
of crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system.
heat provides food for humans, while the clover can fix nitrogen in the soil, improving the fertility of the soil and supporting the growth of the wheat.

Cabbage and radishes: Cabbage and radishes are two crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system. The cabbage takes up a lot of space and can provide shade for the radishes, while the radishes grow quickly and can be harvested before the cabbage reaches maturity.

Carrots and onions: Carrots and onions can also be planted together in an intercropping system. The onions can help to deter pests from attacking the carrots, while the carrots can provide shade for the onions, helping to keep the soil cool and moist.

Tomatoes and basil: Tomatoes and basil are another pair of crops that can be grown together in an intercropping system. The basil can help to repel pests that might attack the tomatoes, and the tomatoes can provide shade for the basil, helping to keep the soil moist and cool.

Overall, there are many different crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system. The specific crops that work well together will depend on the climate, soil conditions, and the goals of the farmer. By choosing complementary crops and arranging them in a way that maximizes their growth and productivity, farmers can create a successful and sustainable intercropping system.
When it comes to using mulch in an intercropping system, there are several best practices to consider. These include:

Choose the right type of mulch: There are many different types of mulch that can be used in an intercropping system, and the right type to use will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. For example, straw or leaves can be effective mulches for most crops, but in a hot climate, it might be better to use lighter-colored mulch, such as wood chips, to reflect the sunlight and keep the soil cool.

Apply the mulch at the right time: It's important to apply the mulch at the right time in order to maximize its benefits. For example, if the mulch is applied too early, it might prevent the crops from germinating properly. If it's applied too late, it might not have enough time to break down and provide nutrients to the soil.

Use the right amount of mulch: It's also important to use the right amount of mulch. If too much mulch is used, it can suffocate the crops and prevent them from growing properly. If too little mulch is used, it might not be effective in conserving moisture or preventing weeds.

Monitor the mulch and the crops: Once the mulch has been applied, it's important to monitor both the mulch and the crops to ensure that they are healthy and growing properly. This can involve checking the moisture levels in the soil, looking for signs of pests or diseases, and making adjustments as needed.

Overall, mulching can be a valuable tool in an intercropping system, but it's important to follow best practices to ensure that it is used effectively. By choosing the right type of mulch, applying it at the right time, using the right amount, and monitoring both the mulch and the crops, farmers can maximize the benefits of mulching and create a more sustainable and productive intercropping system.

There are many different crops that can be intercropped with coconuts, and the specific crops that work well together will depend on a variety of factors, such as the climate, soil conditions, and the goals of the farmer. Some examples of crops that can be intercropped with coconuts include:

Banana: Banana plants can be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the banana plants and making efficient use of the space. The banana plants can also provide food for the local community and can be a source of income for the farmer.

Pineapple: Pineapple plants can also be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the pineapple plants and making efficient use of the space. Pineapples are a popular fruit that can be sold locally or exported for income.

Papaya: Papaya plants can be intercropped with coconut trees, providing shade for the papaya plants and making efficient use of the space. Papayas are nutritious and tasty fruit that can be sold locally or exported for income.

Sweet potatoes: Sweet potatoes can be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the sweet potatoes and making efficient use of the space. Sweet potatoes are nutritious and versatile vegetable
that can be sold locally or used as food for the farmer and their family.

Cassava: Cassava plants can be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the cassava plants and making efficient use of the space. Cassava is a starchy root vegetable that can be used as food for the farmer and their family, or it can be sold locally or exported for income.

In terms of mulch, there are many different types that can be used in a coconut plantation, and the best type to use will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. Some examples of mulch that can be used in a coconut plantation include straw, leaves, wood chips, and coconut coir (the fibrous material that surrounds the coconut seed). These mulches can help to conserve moisture in the soil, prevent weeds from growing, and regulate the temperature of the soil, which can be beneficial for the growth of the crops.

There are several ways to regulate the temperature of the soil, and the best approach will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. Some techniques that can be used to regulate the temperature of the soil include:

Mulching: As I mentioned earlier, mulch can be effective in regulating the temperature of the soil. By placing a layer of organic material on tops of the soil, such as straw or leaves, the mulch can help to retain moisture in the soil, which can help to keep the soil cool in hot weather. In addition, the mulch can also provide a protective layer for the soil, helping to insulate it and prevent it from overheating.

Irrigation: Irrigation can also be used to regulate the temperature of the soil. By applying water to the soil, farmers can help to cool the soil and prevent it from overheating. This is especially important in hot climates, where the soil can easily become dry and hot, which can be detrimental to the growth of the crops.

Shade: Providing shade for the soil can also be effective in regulating its temperature. This can be achieved through the use of trees, buildings, or other structures that cast shade on the soil. By shading the soil, farmers can help to keep it cool and prevent it from overheating, which can be beneficial for the growth of the crops.

Overall, there are many different ways to regulate the temperature of the soil, and the best approach will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. By using techniques such as mulching, irrigation, and providing shade, farmers can help to keep the soil at a stable and optimal temperature, which can improve the growth and productivity of the crops.

The corn provides support for the beans to climb, and the beans can help to fix nitrogen in the soil, which can be beneficial for the corn.Wheat and clover: Wheat and clover are other examples of crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system. Wheat provides food for humans, while the clover can fix nitrogen in the soil, improving the fertility of the soil and supporting the growth of the wheat.Cabbage and radishes: Cabbage and radishes are two crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system. The cabbage takes up a lot of space and can provide shade for the radishes, while the radishes grow quickly and can be harvested before the cabbage reaches maturity.Carrots and onions: Carrots and onions can also be planted together in an intercropping system. The onions can help to deter pests from attacking the carrots, while the carrots can provide shade for the onions, helping to keep the soil cool and moist.Tomatoes and basil: Tomatoes and basil are another pair of crops that can be grown together in an intercropping system. The basil can help to repel pests that might attack the tomatoes, and the tomatoes can provide shade for the basil, helping to keep the soil moist and cool.Overall, there are many different crops that can be planted together in an intercropping system. The specific crops that work well together will depend on the climate, soil conditions, and the goals of the farmer. By choosing complementary crops and arranging them in a way that maximizes their growth and productivity, farmers can create a successful and sustainable intercropping system.When it comes to using mulch in an intercropping system, there are several best practices to consider. These include:Choose the right type of mulch: There are many different types of mulch that can be used in an intercropping system, and the right type to use will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. For example, straw or leaves can be effective mulches for most crops, but in a hot climate, it might be better to use lighter-colored mulch, such as wood chips, to reflect the sunlight and keep the soil cool.Apply the mulch at the right time: It's important to apply the mulch at the right time in order to maximize its benefits. For example, if the mulch is applied too early, it might prevent the crops from germinating properly. If it's applied too late, it might not have enough time to break down and provide nutrients to the soil.Use the right amount of mulch: It's also important to use the right amount of mulch. If too much mulch is used, it can suffocate the crops and prevent them from growing properly. If too little mulch is used, it might not be effective in conserving moisture or preventing weeds.Monitor the mulch and the crops: Once the mulch has been applied, it's important to monitor both the mulch and the crops to ensure that they are healthy and growing properly. This can involve checking the moisture levels in the soil, looking for signs of pests or diseases, and making adjustments as needed.Overall, mulching can be a valuable tool in an intercropping system, but it's important to follow best practices to ensure that it is used effectively. Some examples of crops that can be intercropped with coconuts include:Banana: Banana plants can be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the banana plants and making efficient use of the space. Pineapples are a popular fruit that can be sold locally or exported for income.Papaya: Papaya plants can be intercropped with coconut trees, providing shade for the papaya plants and making efficient use of the space. Papayas are nutritious and tasty fruit that can be sold locally or exported for income.Sweet potatoes: Sweet potatoes can be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the sweet potatoes and making efficient use of the space. Sweet potatoes are nutritious and versatile vegetables that can be sold locally or used as food for the farmer and their family.Cassava: Cassava plants can be grown beneath the canopy of coconut trees, providing shade for the cassava plants and making efficient use of the space. Cassava is a starchy root vegetable that can be used as food for the farmer and their family, or it can be sold locally or exported for income.In terms of mulch, there are many different types that can be used in a coconut plantation, and the best type to use will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. Some examples of mulch that can be used in a coconut plantation include straw, leaves, wood chips, and coconut coir (the fibrous material that surrounds the coconut seed). These mulches can help to conserve moisture in the soil, prevent weeds from growing, and regulate the temperature of the soil, which can be beneficial for the growth of the crops.There are several ways to regulate the temperature of the soil, and the best approach will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. Some techniques that can be used to regulate the temperature of the soil include:Mulching: As I mentioned earlier, mulch can be effective in regulating the temperature of the soil. By placing a layer of organic material on tops of the soil, such as straw or leaves, the mulch can help to retain moisture in the soil, which can help to keep the soil cool in hot weather. In addition, the mulch can also provide a protective layer for the soil, helping to insulate it and prevent it from overheating.Irrigation: Irrigation can also be used to regulate the temperature of the soil. By applying water to the soil, farmers can help to cool the soil and prevent it from overheating. This is especially important in hot climates, where the soil can easily become dry and hot, which can be detrimental to the growth of the crops.Shade: Providing shade for the soil can also be effective in regulating its temperature. This can be achieved through the use of trees, buildings, or other structures that cast shade on the soil. By shading the soil, farmers can help to keep it cool and prevent it from overheating, which can be beneficial for the growth of the crops.Overall, there are many different ways to regulate the temperature of the soil, and the best approach will depend on the specific crops being grown and the climate. By using techniques such as mulching, irrigation, and providing shade, farmers can help to keep the soil at a stable and optimal temperature, which can improve the growth and productivity of the crops.

children.title: Content regarding KKN Moloch Token

content.text: The motivation behind creating a Moloch DAO token named "KKN" is to enable the use of DAO tooling that is not automatically compatible with Moloch DAOs. By creating a mirror of Kokonut DAO shares in the form of a non-transferable ERC-20 token, it becomes possible to use this token with DAO tooling that only supports ERC-20 tokens. This can allow the Kokonut DAO to take advantage of the various benefits and features offered by the tooling, such as enhanced voting mechanisms, improved transparency, and automatic execution of smart contracts. By mirroring the Kokonut DAO shares, the KKN token can retain the same value and ownership structure as the underlying shares, allowing the Kokonut DAO to maintain its existing governance model and align the interests of its token holders with those of the Kokonut DAO.

Based on the result of creating a non-transferable ERC-20 token that mirrors the Kokonut DAO shares, it seems that the future of this token will be as a governance token for the Kokonut DAO. Because it is not transferable or liquid, it will not be available on the open market and will only be used within the Kokonut DAO's governance system. This can help to ensure that the governance of the DAO remains decentralized and transparent and that the interests of the token holders are aligned with those of the Kokonut DAO.

To provide liquidity for the Kokonut DAO, it is planned to create a new token based on the production of coconuts. This token will serve as a payment method for exchanging coconuts and will be controlled by the DAO. This can allow the Kokonut DAO to generate revenue and provide a means for its members to access liquidity, while still maintaining the integrity of its governance system through the use of the KKN token.

Overall, the future of the KKN token seems to be a key component of the Kokonut DAO's governance system, providing a transparent and decentralized means of decision-making and aligning the interests of its members. The creation of a new, liquid token based on coconut production will provide the necessary liquidity for the DAO and its members.

children.title: Problem & Solution Deep Dive

content.text: There are several problems that agriculture cooperatives can help solve, including:
Lack of access to financing: Agriculture cooperatives can help farmers access financing by pooling their resources and leveraging their collective bargaining power to secure loans or investments.

High production costs: Cooperatives can help farmers reduce their production costs by sharing resources, such as equipment and facilities, and by negotiating bulk purchasing agreements with suppliers.

Limited market access: Cooperatives can provide farmers with a collective marketing and distribution system, allowing them to access a wider range of customers and fetch better prices for their products.
Poor infrastructure: Cooperatives can help farmers invest in infrastructure
, such as irrigation systems, storage facilities, and processing plants, which can improve the quality and value of their products.
Drought and other natural disasters: Cooperatives can provide farmers with access to insurance and other risk management tools to help them cope with the effects of natural disasters.
Lack of knowledge and technical expertise: Cooperatives can provide farmers with training and support to help them improve their agricultural practices and adopt new technologies.

One way to approach the challenges of lack of access to funding and limited market access is by forming agriculture cooperatives. Cooperatives can help farmers pool their resources and leverage their collective bargaining power to secure loans and investments. They can also provide a collective marketing and distribution system, allowing farmers to access a wider range of customers and fetch better prices for their products.

In addition to forming cooperatives, farmers can also seek out partnerships and other collaborative arrangements with organizations that can provide access to funding and markets. This can include working with financial institutions, government agencies, and private sector companies to secure financing and expand market opportunities.

Farmers can also consider adopting new technologies and innovative business models that can help them access funding and markets. For example, using digital platforms and e-commerce can enable farmers to reach a wider audience and sell their products directly to consumers.

Finally, engaging with policymakers and advocating for policies that support the agricultural sector can also help address these challenges. This can include advocating for access to financing, market opportunities, and other resources that can help farmers overcome challenges and succeed.

Lack of access to financing: Web3 technology can enable farmers to access alternative sources of financing, such as decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms and peer-to-peer lending networks, which can provide access to capital without the need for traditional intermediaries.
Limited market access: Web3 technology can help farmers connect directly with customers and other stakeholders, enabling them to bypass traditional intermediaries and access global markets.

Poor infrastructure: Web3 technology can facilitate the creation of decentralized infrastructure, such as decentralized storage and distribution networks, which can help farmers improve the quality and value of their products.
Drought and other natural disasters: Web3 technology can help farmers access insurance and other risk management tools that are decentralized and resistant to disruption from natural disasters.

Lack of knowledge and technical expertise: Web3 technology can provide farmers with access to decentralized networks of experts and communities of practice, which can help them improve their agricultural practices and adopt new technologies.

Inefficient supply chains: Web3 technology can help farmers create decentralized supply chains that are more transparent, efficient, and resilient, enabling them to better compete with large-scale agribusinesses.
The best way to approach and solve these challenges will vary depending on the specific situation and context. However, some general strategies that can be effective include:

Develop a comprehensive strategy: It is important to carefully assess the challenges facing the agricultural sector and develop a comprehensive plan to address them. This should involve input from all relevant stakeholders, including farmers, cooperatives, government agencies, and other organizations.

Invest in infrastructure: Improving infrastructure, such as irrigation systems, storage facilities, and processing plants, can help farmers increase productivity and improve the quality and value of their products.

Provide support and training: Farmers often face challenges due to a lack of knowledge and technical expertise. Providing access to training and support can help them improve their agricultural practices and adopt new technologies.

Foster collaboration and partnerships: Working together with other farmers, cooperatives, and organizations can help farmers overcome challenges and achieve better results. This can involve forming partnerships, sharing resources, and leveraging collective bargaining power.

Use technology and innovation: Advances in technology and innovation can help farmers improve their productivity and efficiency. This can include using precision agriculture techniques, data analytics, and other tools to optimize agricultural practices.

Engage with policymakers: It is important to engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector. This can include advocating for access to financing, market opportunities, and other resources that can help farmers overcome challenges and succeed.
Why do we have to act now?

These problems affect all humans on earth because they are fundamental challenges facing the global food system. Agriculture is a vital part of the global economy, and the challenges facing the sector can have far-reaching consequences for food security, the environment, and economic development.

For example, lack of access to financing and limited market access can make it difficult for farmers to invest in their operations and improve productivity, which can lead to higher prices and lower availability of food. Poor infrastructure and inefficient supply chains can also result in food waste and environmental degradation, which can have negative impacts on the environment and human health.

It is important to take action now to address these challenges because the global population is growing, and demand for food is expected to increase in the coming decades. If we do not take steps to address these challenges now, they are likely to become more acute in the future, with potentially severe consequences for global food security and human welfare.

By creating agricultural cooperative models that use web3 technology, we can address these challenges and help create a more sustainable and resilient global food system. Web3 technology can enable farmers to access new sources of financing, connect directly with customers, improve infrastructure, manage risks, and access knowledge and expertise, which can help them overcome these challenges and create a more prosperous and sustainable agricultural sector.
Here are some action points that can be implemented based on the need to address the challenges facing the global food system:

Encourage the adoption of web3 technology in the agricultural sector: Web3 technology offers many potential benefits for the agricultural sector, including access to alternative sources of financing, improved market access, decentralized infrastructure, and access to knowledge and expertise. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can support the adoption of web3 technology in the agricultural sector by providing education, training, and other resources to help farmers and cooperatives use these technologies effectively.

Invest in infrastructure and support services: Improving infrastructure and support services can help farmers increase productivity and improve the quality and value of their products. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can invest in infrastructure and support services, such as irrigation systems, storage facilities, and processing plants, to help farmers overcome these challenges and succeed.

Provide access to financing and market opportunities: Access to financing and market opportunities is essential for farmers to invest in their operations and improve productivity. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can support the development of alternative financing mechanisms, such as decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms, to help farmers access capital. They can also support the development of decentralized marketplaces and other platforms that can help farmers connect directly with customers and other stakeholders.

Engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector: It is important to engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector. This can include advocating for access to financing, market opportunities, and other resources that can help farmers overcome challenges and succeed. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can work together to engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector and help address the challenges facing the global food system.

children.title: Real World Oracles

content.text: Digital oracles are a type of smart contract that use off-chain data to trigger on-chain actions. This allows blockchains, which are typically isolated from the outside world, to interact with external information sources. For example, a digital oracle could be used to link a prediction market to a real-world event, such as the outcome of an election. When the event occurs, the oracle would provide the result to the blockchain, which would then automatically execute the appropriate actions based on the outcome.
There are several different types of oracles, including:
Inbound oracles: These oracles provide external data to the blockchain, such as the result of a real-world event.
Outbound oracles: These oracles take data from the blockchain and send it to external systems, such as triggering a payment when a certain condition is met.
Autonomous oracles: These oracles operate without any human intervention, using pre-defined rules to automatically interact with external systems.
Oracle networks: These are decentralized networks of oracles that provide a more secure and reliable way of accessing external data.
Hybrid oracles: These combine the capabilities of inbound and outbound oracles, allowing for two-way communication between the blockchain and external systems.

As I mentioned earlier, inbound oracles are a type of oracle that provide external data to the blockchain. This data could be the result of a real-world event, such as the outcome of an election, the weather, or the price of a particular asset. Inbound oracles are typically used to trigger smart contracts on the blockchain, allowing them to execute automatically based on real-world events.

Oracle networks, on the other hand, are decentralized networks of oracles that provide a more secure and reliable way of accessing external data. These networks are composed of multiple oracles, each of which provides a different source of data. The data provided by these oracles is then aggregated and used to trigger smart contracts on the blockchain. This approach helps to reduce the risk of a single point of failure, as the oracle network is not dependent on any one individual oracle.
Inbound and oracle networks could be used in agriculture in

ways. For example, inbound oracles could be used to trigger smart contracts based on real-time weather data. This could be used to automatically adjust irrigation systems or to activate certain pest control measures when conditions are favorable for the spread of disease.

Oracle networks, on the other hand, could be used to provide reliable and trustworthy data on the supply and demand of agricultural commodities. This data could be used by farmers and traders to make informed decisions about planting, harvesting, and selling their crops.
Overall, the use of inbound oracles and oracle networks in agriculture could help to increase efficiency, reduce waste, and improve the overall sustainability of the industry.
Here is a possible gameplan for using inbound oracles and oracle networks in a coconut plantation:
Set up sensors throughout the plantation to collect real-time data on factors such as temperature, humidity, soil moisture, and pest populations.
Use inbound oracles to connect this data to the blockchain, allowing it to be accessed by smart contracts.

Create smart contracts that are triggered by the data from the inbound oracles. For example, a smart contract could be set up to automatically adjust the irrigation system based on the soil moisture levels, or to activate pest control measures when certain conditions are met.

Use an oracle network to provide reliable and trustworthy data on the supply and demand of coconuts. This could include data on the current market price of coconuts, as well as the demand for different varieties and grades of the fruit.

Use this data to inform decisions about planting, harvesting, and selling coconuts. For example, smart contracts could be set up to automatically sell a certain amount of coconuts when the market price reaches a certain level, or to purchase additional fertilizers when the demand for a certain variety of coconut is high.

Overall, this game plan would use inbound oracles and oracle networks to improve the efficiency and sustainability of the coconut plantation, by using real-time data to automate key decisions and reduce waste.

In addition, the use of smart contracts would help to ensure the reliability and security of the plantation's operations. Overall, the combination of digital oracles and smart contracts in your coconut plantation would likely lead to improved operation capacity and stability.
There are several steps you can take to make your oracle network more trustable:

Use a decentralized network of oracles: By using multiple oracles, each with its source of data, you can reduce the risk of a single point of failure and ensure that your network is not dependent on any one individual oracle.
Use a consensus mechanism to validate the data provided by the oracles: This can help to ensure that the data provided by the oracles is accurate and reliable.

Implement security measures to protect against malicious actors: This could include using cryptographic techniques to secure the data provided by the oracles, or implementing reputation systems to incentivize good behavior.

Transparently disclose the sources and methods used by the oracles: By making this information public, you can help users of the network understand the reliability and trustworthiness of the data provided by the oracles.
Overall, by implementing these measures, you can increase the trustworthiness of your oracle network and improve its reliability and security.

- Information about the irrigation system (current settings, capacity to adjust water provided, etc.)

- IrrigationController: Triggered by the SoilMoistureLow event and automatically adjusts the irrigation system.
- CoconutSeller: Triggered by the CoconutPriceHigh event and automatically sells a certain amount of coconuts.

- Improved efficiency and sustainability of the coconut plantation, through the use of real-time data and automated decision-making.
- Reliability and security of the plantation's operations, through the use of smart contracts and a decentralized oracle network.

We are excited to invite you to join our team and help us implement a cutting-edge technology solution for our coconut plantation.

Our goal is to use digital oracles and smart contracts to improve the efficiency and sustainability of our plantation. By collecting real-time data and automatically executing pre-defined rules, we believe that we can achieve significant benefits, such as reduced waste, improved decision-making, and increased reliability and security of our operations.
We are looking for experts and individuals with experience in the following areas:
Setting up and managing sensors and other devices to collect real-time data
Implementing inbound oracles and oracle networks to connect external data to the blockchain
Developing and deploying smart contracts on the blockchain

If you have expertise in these areas and are interested in joining our team, we would love to hear from you. Please get in touch with us to discuss the details and learn more about this exciting opportunity.

children.title: Research Coconut By-Products Industrial Use

content.text: Industries Top Players alongside Person to Reach about Partnerships within the Dominican Republic
Some industries that could potentially benefit from a partnership with a coconut plantation include the following:

Food and beverage: Coconut water, coconut milk, and coconut oil are popular ingredients in many types of food and drinks. A partnership with a coconut plantation could provide a consistent and reliable source of these products.

Beauty and personal care: Coconut oil is often used in a variety of beauty and personal care products, such as soaps, lotions, and hair care products. A partnership with a coconut plantation could provide a source of high-quality coconut oil for these products.

Animal feed: Coconut meal, which is the byproduct of coconut oil production, is a common ingredient in animal feed. A partnership with a coconut plantation could provide a source of this type of feed for livestock farmers.
Biofuels: Coconut oil can be used to produce biodiesel, which is a type of renewable fuel. A partnership with a coconut plantation could provide a source of coconut oil for biodiesel production.

Manufacturing: Coconut fiber, also known as coir, is used in a variety of products, including mats, ropes, and brushes. A partnership with a coconut plantation could provide a source of coir for these products.
Overall, a partnership with a coconut plantation could provide various benefits to a wide range of industries, depending on the specific needs and goals of the partnership.

children.title: Kokonut Funnel

content.text: Awareness: The first step in the marketing funnel is to raise awareness about the agriculture project and its goals. This can be done through various marketing channels, such as social media, email marketing, and content marketing. The goal of this step is to get people interested in the project and to build a following.

Interest: The second step in the marketing funnel is to generate interest in the project and its benefits. This can be done through engaging content, such as blog posts, videos, and infographics, that showcase the project and its impact. The goal of this step is to get people excited about the project and to encourage them to learn more.

Decision: The third step in the marketing funnel is to help people make a decision about whether to support the project. This can be done through clear and concise messaging that explains the benefits of supporting the project, as well as through persuasive calls to action that encourage people to take action. The goal of this step is to get people to commit to supporting the project.

Action: The fourth step in the marketing funnel is to get people to take action and support the project. This can be done through various channels, such as a donation page, a sign-up form, or a purchase page. The goal of this step is to get people to take the desired action and support the project.

Retention: The final step in the marketing funnel is to retain the support of people who have already taken action and supported the project. This can be done through regular communication and updates about the progress of the project, as well as through thank you messages and other forms of appreciation. The goal of this step is to keep people engaged and interested in the project and to encourage them to continue supporting it.

children.title: Simplified Roadmap 2022

content.text: [ Lo que se hizo, lo que se esta haciendo ahora mismo (vendiendo los shares hasta 20% pa empezar los trabajos), y lo que se har√° despu√©s del 20% vendido] + Full Featured Roadmap Until 2024
Vamos a hacer un roadmap interactivo y lleno de informaci√≥n en texto y gr√°ficos aqu√≠ mismo en notion.

## Kokonut Network idea and vision initial research

We went deep into the worldwide coconut market as a whole, for almost an entire year. We compiled as much information as possible to design a perfect landscape for our coconut farm, token economics, and token development.

# May 2020

## Team Selection

Three business professionals are going to be responsible for this Project. Crop, sales, and further development of Kokonut Network have 35+ years, of combined experience in the private and public agriculture sector.

# June 2020

## Kokonut Network domain and branding

We wanted to choose a short name and a brand that reflects our love for mother nature, social responsibility, and the vision we have for the agriculture communities worldwide. "Kokonut Network" represents what we're striving for as a global community.

# September 2020

## Budget and land to deploy the project

Once the initial research was completed and successful, we were able to have the final budget and secure the 620 Acres of land needed. A full 60,000 Coconut Plants Farm.

# January 2021

## Blockchain, Wallet, Token Issuance & ERP to manage The Farm

We are using WAVES Blockchain for secure, cheap & fast transactions.

Custom Kokonut Wallet for an easy-to-use interface, token price & transfers.

**Open Source ERP System**¬†was specially developed to manage agricultural projects. We're going to be able to share monthly reports and updates, about how the project is performing in: Sales projections, profits & expenses reports. We're all about transparency.

# April 2021

## Mobile & Web App Initial Research

We wanted to have an "app" rather than a simple website, this approach allows us to develop a comprehensive experience for each of the stages of the project. An experience that is going to be available on every major web & mobile platform.

# July 2021

## Mobile & Web App Development

For us to be able to bring our app vision to life, we needed to make it available for everyone no matter the device or operating system. Our Kokonut Network app will be available for iOS, Android & Web for any Desktop or Mobile Browser.

# Nov 2021

## Kokonut Network Public Sale

After a successful private sale, we will list the tokens on the free market via "Waves Exchange".  Liquidity for an automated process with "no cap" on how many tokens you can buy. There will be no time limit and we will run the public sale until all of the 60,000.00 Kokonut V1 tokens are sold to the community.

# December 2021

## Land Preparation for coconut seedlings

This is a 2-3 month procedure where we're going to prepare our 620 Acres of land, for the plantation of the 60,000 coconut seedlings.

# Feb 2022

## Farm Harvesting Timeline

The land will be ready to be cultivated by Feb. 2022. Where we will be able to make the initial projections for the first harvest and profit distribution among our community.

children.title: Organizational Chart Function A-Z

content.text: Eg: Usuario > Solicitud De Miembro $$ > DAO VAULT > Kokonut Budget Proposal > Sistema En La Nube > Comunidad Agricola, SRL > Ejecutar/Pagar Trabajo

Governance Layer: this layer is composed of the Kokonut DAO members. Their tasks are to oversight and vote on proposals for the benefit of Kokonut Network; Anyone with at least 1 Kokonut DAO share can participate in the DAO governance.

Blockchain Layer: this layer is where the DAO lives securely, as well as the treasury, list of shareholders, funding & membership proposals voting. All of the information critical for the transparency and lastingness of the project is publicly available in the Gnosis Chain.

Execution Layer: after approval by Kokonut DAO members, this layer functions as the body where execution of budget & work plan takes place. Composed by the Core Team & Kokonut DAO Contributors & Global Enterprise Partners.

Production Layer: this is where the magic happens! In this layer, we bring to life our mission of building, producing, and globally distributing our Coconuts & Derivatives products. Kokonut v1 is our first plantation composed of 60,000 coconut plants within 620 acres of land with a yearly production of 18 million coconuts.
